page.title: 06CITY TAKEOVER 1
page.content: Residents of Efail Isaf are worried about the prospects of a new and large housing development on the outskirts of the village and are actively opposing the plans. The developers plan to build 100 detached houses selling for between #30,000 and #50,000 each . They argue that such a large development will, by increasing the population, generally make the area more attractive, provide a base of labour and therefore encourage employers to the area and provide extra custom for local shops making them more viable. The main concern of the opponents is that Efail Isaf will become like Radyr. Twenty years ago Radyr was a small village on the outskirts of Cardiff. One housing development grew into another and so on.
